quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yesterday, Angela may or may not have figured out that I’m having an affair with her husband. So I just have to wait and see. When she comes in, if she’s cold and awkward and cruel to me, then great, it’s business as usual.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Good morning. [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oscar... [sighs] can I ask you a question?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [whispering] Of course, ask me a que--  questions.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Is it cool in here to you?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [hoarsely] Yes, a little bit. [normal voice] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I think the thermostat is acting up again.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It’s the stupid thermostat! That thing is a catastrophe. So I’m gonna, um, on your suggestion, get someone to fix it. I’ll just go downstairs.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No, thank you, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: She doesn’t know. I shouldn’t be surprised. This is a woman who married a man who is obviously a homosexual. Basically, she has her head in the sand. In a way I feel sorry for her. I guess the universe rewards true love.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, well, well, it’s finally happened. Pam has ceased caring.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: These are my painting clothes.I think I’m gonna do it. I am really gonna start painting the warehouse mural today. [Jim applauds]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sure you don’t want to put another coat of primer on that Pam?Queen of the primer, that one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You got this, Beesley. Actually, do you want me to come down and help you get started?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you avoiding your phone call?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? Yeah, right. As if.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Today I will be asking David Wallace if I can start working part-time, because the sports marketing company that I started really needs me to be there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Last week Jim wasn’t there, and they named the company Athlead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I could have prevented that. So I have to talk to Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Tell them your opening line.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [sighs] Hey David, how would you like a guy who’s not here as much, gets paid the same amount of salary, and has bigger fish to fry in Philadelphia?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think it’s good. He likes fishing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: This is gonna be awful.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: One of my jobs is to input customer complaints into the computer. And when they’re in, I fill out one of these cards. But the information’s already on the computer, so....why am I filling out the card? I asked Andy, and he told me to “chillax,” and then went away on a big, long boat ride. So here we are. Don’t give me a pointless office chore, because I will build a little paper house.  Fight the power.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Meet me in the old place, five minutes. I need you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [upon seeing Dwight naked] Ugh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on in, the water’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight, it’s not that kind of meeting. Put your clothes back on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know. That’s not why I’m naked. I always work out without my clothes. [does jumping jacks]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Just put them on! Put on your clothes. I need your help. I need someone who can operate outside of the law. Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, I’m sorry, your vigilante privileges ended when you broke up with me. If I’m not in your panties, I don’t go vigilantes. Why don’t you ask your husband?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: My marriage is in danger. I don’t know who I can trust. I need someone to be there for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sighs] All right, what are we talking? Surveillance, wire-tapping?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Something like that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, the less I know, the better. I know just the guy. He was a volunteer sheriff too. Kicked off the force.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Can you arrange a meeting?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can try. I’m gonna use SMS text.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Text went through.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All we can do is sit and wait.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [phone vibrates] Oh, look at that. Yeah, he’s free anytime. Not a problem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I mean, I can handle any client issues from Philly.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: [on phone] Yeah, but I really need someone in the office. If there’s a crisis -- the more I think about it --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, you mean handle it in person. Oh, well, Phyllis and Stanley have agree to cover for me while I’m gone.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: They did?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Oh, okay. Well, that is different. In that case, yes-- Maybe this can work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Why should we help you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because we’re friends.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: When is my birthday?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Unfair. When’s my birthday?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I don’t know, because we’re not friends.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How about this-- You let me take you to lunch, and I make my case?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Now we’re talkin’.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Make it go taller.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: That’s the idea.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, not taller this way, taller this way. [gesturing with hands]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Well, I’ve gotta build a wider base first before I can go higher.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You’re not getting this, Peter.  Make it go wider... up!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Will do.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: [entering] What are y’all doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Me and Pete are building a tower.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Cool. It should be taller though, right?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Obviously. He’s a sweet kid, Darryl. But he’s not the sharpest guy in the drawer.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Kevin, I can hear you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ow! Dwight! Ow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get in the van.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: God!

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Is it safe to talk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, this documentary crew has been following our every move for the past nine years, but I don’t see them so I think we’re good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: So what are your credentials?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: I started following people around to get exercise. Turns out, I’m damn good at it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Do you have a gun?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [snickers] Does he own a gun? Show her.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: You tell me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: It’s the receipt for my gun.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You don’t carry it with you?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Read the receipt. That’s a $300 gun. Someone could steal it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do you have any idea how many guns Trevor’s had stolen from him?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Now I keep it in a safe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mm-hmm. Good safe?

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Oh, you tell me. [shows Dwight receipt]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [studying mural wall] I guess if I make a mistake, I can just paint over it with a shrub or something. It’s just, I think less of paintings with a lot of shrubs. So, I’m gonna limit myself to one shrub.

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.line: You paint wall now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. Painting now. I just want to make sure that...

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.line: You paint now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It’s probably gonna be a few minutes. So you can just go back to doing whatever you were doing.

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.line: I wait.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sweet.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yay!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That’s what I’m talkin’ about.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: This next card comes to us thanks to Meredith Palmer, who called Eastern Pennsylvania Seminary a, quote ‘sausage factory.’

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Oh OOOH!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [approving cheers]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Boom!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Bang.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yep, yep, yep.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: All right. Up next we got a whole lotta Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Let’s find out what I did.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You get half now and half upon completion of said job.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: And that’s all off the books?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Obviously.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Nice. No taxes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay, so everything you need to know about the target is in here.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: So what’s the job?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Murder.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Okay, that’s the big one. That’s the big “M.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You can’t have someone murdered.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What if they deserved it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What did they do to you, Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: They’re sleeping with my husband.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, Monkey. Oh, I feel for you.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: This seems a little crazy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes. Crazy. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: But I think I’m up for it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! No!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Absolutely not. There are a lot of different ways to get revenge. I’ve had great success by defecating in a paper bag, put it on the porch--

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: That’s very effective. I’ve been on the receiving end of that quite a few times. It’s devastating.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, no, no. It has to be physical. I want this person to suffer.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: What about a knee-capping?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! You’re not helping, Trevor!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes, a knee-capping could work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. Angela! What are you saying?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You said you would be there for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I’m trying, but what you’re asking is--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It’s the only thing that will make this right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. But it’s cruel, because a woman with damaged knees can’t scrub worth a damn.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: All right, then it’s settled. One knee-capping. Now, the hit goes down at 4:00. Keep in mind, once I leave, there’s no turning back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know, truth be told, I think all you’ll really be doing is accepting calls from my clients while I’m gone.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: We’ve got all afternoon to talk about that.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Morning, folks.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I’ll have the surf and turf with a side order of lobster.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Actually, the surf and turf does come with lob--

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Not enough lobster. Side order.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: How much wine do you have?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I brought you a cookie.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, thanks, Oscar. You’re such an angel.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [talking into phone] I just gave her a cookie, and she called me an angel, so... yeah, we’re good. Yeah. [exhales] We dodged a bullet, yes. Okay. Yeah. Yeah, yeah-- Well, I gotta go now, but-- Okay, bye. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: There we go.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Nicely done. Very nicely done. All right, this next one goes to Darryl for pocket dialing a customer while having sex.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oooohh... you salty dog.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Well, yeah, what can I say, a player’s gotta play.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Actually, that was the sound of me eating spaghetti. But I’m gonna let them think the other thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Okay, I got this one.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, be careful! Be careful! Be careful

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, I got it. Easy does it, everyone. Nobody even take a breath.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [shouting as tower collapses] Oh no! Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: What did I just say? What did I just say?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Hey, hey, hey, it’s just a mistake. Just a mistake. That’s what this tower’s all about --  mistakes. Okay, if you’re afraid of screwing up, the tower’s not for you. Show of hands --- who here has never had a complaint? That’s right. Nobody. See that? Nobody. Okay? Let’s get back to work, huh? Come on, you in?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: There we go. All right, let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know, at the end of the day, it’s really only two days. I mean, I’ll be back in the office.  If you need me for an emergency, call me.  I’ll be there...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You know what? I don’t know where the years went.  ‘Cause sometimes when I look at my hands, I don’t even recognize them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Tell me about it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Whose hands are these? [holding out her hands to Jim] Theyre not my hands. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right. You know what?  Maybe we’ll just... We’ll go slow.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No. Jim... [wine bottle clangs on plate]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: All right. Check it out.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Like a Phoenix from the ashes. Ksshhhh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nice.  Pretty soon, we’re gonna be at the ceiling.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Can you hand me a card?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Um,. it’s empty.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, come on. We could use a blank card.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: No!!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: That’s cheating.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I could get us a complaint.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: You? Little Miss Priss? You wouldn’t fart on a butterfly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, I wouldn’t. I can’t even relate to that impulse. But I bet I could get us a customer complaint. I’d like to try.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Hmm. Yeah.  All right! Yea, go, Pam! Pam...

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [chanting] “Pam!”

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What? Why did you call me out here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The target-- it’s Oscar, isn’t it? He and the senator are gaying each other.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Your nostrils tell a different story. They flare like that every time you’re engaging in deception. Hello again, naughty nostrils.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Fine! It’s Oscar. So what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well I could understand you wanting to get a stranger’s knees whacked. But a co-worker-- Dare I say, a friend?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Exactly, a friend. Someone who sits next to you year after year, making chitchat and smiling, and all the while running behind your back and defiling your marriage and seducing your husband.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can’t even imagine how painful this must be for you. But the first ones to break your marriage vows were you and me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Well, you might be right. But it’s too late now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: He’s here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! No, no! [groans]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oscar? Oscar. Oscar, good. Hey come with me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come -- come with me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There are a bunch of construction workers in the warehouse without their trousers, drinking diet sodas. You have got to see this. They’re extraordinary.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yahtzee.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Sandwich delivery for Mr. Oscar Martinez.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I am Oscar Martinez.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, not him, not him. Outside. Outside.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Wha-- wh--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You know, there’s doughnuts in the break room.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nice! Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Listen, I was really wondering if maybe we could lock this down before lunch is over.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Don’t be pushy Jim. It’s tacky.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right. Phyllis! Phyllis, that’s-- that’s decorative.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No, there’s wine in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Still decorative.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Is it white wine?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [to customer] Can you help me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Don’t-- don’t-- don’t pole people with knives.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [groaning while trying to open giant wine bottle] ha ha!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Phyllis!  Wow.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Ooh, bring it over.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There’s no time to explain. [descending stairs] Okay, actually, there is time to explain. When Angela found out that you seduced her husband, we hired a guy to break your knee caps.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Oh, my God! What is wrong wiht you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What is wrong with you? There are a million gorgeous guys in the Scranton Wilkes-Barre area, and you choose the man who’s the father of her child?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, don’t lie. I’m trying to save those precious knees you’re always bragging about.  Now, let’s get out of here. He could be right behind us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Aah! Actually, he’s right in front of us.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Let’s get it on. I’m gonna do this. I might-- I might puke, but I’m gonna do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, Trevor, I am not gonna let you. He’s a Dunder-Mifflin man. He’s my tribe.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: I’m sorry, Dwight, but for once in my stupid, stupid life, I’m gonna follow through on something, all right? I have masculinity issues-- Stop! No!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Disarm!

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: You don’t-- [all three grunting]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don’t move. And disarm now! [Oscar gets weapon away from others]

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: Okay, okay, okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! No, Oscar. He’s a friend. He’s a friend.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Okay, the client is Heymont Brake and Tire. They’re family-owned, but don’t let that take away from your edge!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Come on, Pam, I know you can fail. I see failure in you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Remember, you’re a scumbag, so you think scummy thoughts. Like this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [into phone] Hello, this is Pam Halpert. I’m calling from Dunder-Mifflin. Yes, your paper provider. And I just called to say... your mama is so fat, when she wears red, people yell, “Hey, kool-aid.” Yeah, your mama’s fat. This is Pam Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Did she buy it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Basically I couldn’t tell, but I think...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Were they angry?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I-- I thought they were confused at least...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin. This is Erin. Yes, you can. Okay. I will make sure that goes on file. [hangs up] Ladies and gentlemen, we just lost a client!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [cheering]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nice. Nice.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: You did good. You did good.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: See ya later, Heymont.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Trevor
quotes.line: If you chase me, I will run so fast. If you catch me I will bite so hard. Got it? Good-bye, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What the hell, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: See ya later, Trevor.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: you are incorrigible!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I just saved your life. You’re welcome!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You hired someone to hit me with a pipe!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You deserved every bit of it!  You made my husband gay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What-- what I did was wrong, and I have to live with that every day. But your husband is... gay. He was gay when you married him!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. No.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Angela, until you face that, you’re gonna be confused and angry for all the wrong reasons. But if you want to blame me for the whole thing, go ahead -- I won’t stop you. Hit me. you have my blessing. Hit me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Well are you gonna let go of it? Because part of the blame is definitely on you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Angela, it’s a lead freaking pipe.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: God! [kicks Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Aah!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You were supposed to be my friend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I’m so sorry. Angela--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Our crowning complaint card comes to us thanks to Pamela Halpert...

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: For insulting a client’s recently deceased mother.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I did not know that.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Well, a woman who struggled with obesity all her life.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I’m so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: yeah. That’s-- that is terrible.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [cheers and applause as Pete puts last card on tower]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You did it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I feel so stupid. I sit next to him every day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You’re not stupid. Jazz is stupid.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [crying] Jazz is stupid!  I mean, just play the right notes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know. You’re gonna be okay, Monkey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don’t like your friend Trevor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don’t like him either.  And yet I really like him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, we’re here. Perfect.  [covers sleeping Phyllis with his jacket]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: We’re gonna cover for you, ya know.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Phyllis, what was that?Phyllis are you dreaming, or--

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [laughing] I did enjoy grinding your beans, son.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [laughing] Yeah, we really did peel your grapes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: This is hilarious, but we’re gonna stop with all--

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Shuckin’ your peas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Shuckin’ the peas.  You should go back to the first part, though. You are  gonna  cover for me?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Of course we are, Jimmy. We love you guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, my God, thank you. [hugging both] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: If you’re an artist, you have to be okay with the idea  that you can’t please everybody all the time.

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.line: You paint very bad--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Shut up, Hide!  I mean, do you think Kevin cares what people think about him-- or Creed or Meredith? Oh my gosh, these are my role models now. You know what? I’m okay with that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Where does gayness come from? And how is it transmitted?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: That is-- that is a loaded question.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: My pastor said it can come from breast feeding.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: He said that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Well, he didn’t fight me hard on it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I-- I don’t know if there’s truth to-- to, uh, to that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What is it called when two men intertwine their penises like the snakes on the medic-alert bracelet?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh... uh...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Is it called red-vining?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is it called red-vining?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I don’t...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We heard it was called red-vining.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: People red vine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Where are gay mens’ vaginas?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: They don’t have vaginas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No. They’re just regular men.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: When two gay men have sex, how do they know whose penis will open up to accept the other person’s penis?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Uh... wow....
